_prev_prog_3.CH_OtherChanges: Installation of secondary emergency exit route
_prev_prog_3.TR_OtherType: Off-site at ammonia refrigeration training program

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN¿s refrigeration system consists of receivers, compressors, evaporators, condensers, and piping, which can contain an amount in excess of 10,000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia. 

Worst Case / Alternative Release Scenario

In accordance with 40 CFR Part 68, Subpart B, Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN evaluated off-site consequences for releases of anhydrous ammonia.  Both a worst case scenario and an alternative case scenario were developed.

Accidental Release Prevention Program

The ammonia refrigeration system is designed and constructed in accordance with ANSI/IIAR 2-1992 Standard for Equipment, Design, and Installation of Ammonia Mechanical Refrigeration Systems.  To prevent and mitigate accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia, Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN has implemented several precautionary measures.

Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN has developed and implemented a PSM program pursuant to OSHA regulations and as such, has evaluated the system for potential anhydrous ammonia releases.  Some of the controls installed to prevent catastrophic releases of ammonia are process equipment (vents, pressure relief valves, backup pumps, and manual shutoffs) and automated controls (automatic shut-off), ammonia leak detection system, and electrical distribution system grounding.  In addition, Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN has trained personnel to respond to potential ammonia releases (Emergency Response/Hazardous Materials team).

Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN has developed standard operating procedures for all employees and contractors that have contact with the ammonia refrigeration system that incorporate safety measures into the procedures.  These safety procedures were developed by refrigeration system operators and are reviewed at a frequency sufficient to assure that they reflect current operating practice, including changes that result from changes in the process chemicals, technology, and equipment, and changes

to the facility.  Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN encourages employee participation in development of the control measures used at the plant by means of company memoranda and training sessions.  Pursuant to written management of change procedures established by Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN, any changes to the operating procedures are to be communicated to affected employees.

Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN understands that maintaining the refrigeration system in good working order is essential to preventing accidental releases; therefore Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN has implemented a preventative maintenance program.  The preventative maintenance program is scheduled, documented and managed using log sheets to ensure that regular maintenance occurs on the system.  These log sheets are maintained in the Refrigeration office for three years.  Also, to ensure the mechanical integrity of critical refrigeration system components, equipment tests are performed.  Specifically, the equipment is tested to detect corrosion.  This equipment consists of pressure vessels, headers, and piping.

To ensure that Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN¿s control measures are effective in maintaining the safe operation of the plant, regularly scheduled audits are performed on the ammonia refrigeration system:

¿ In accordance with the PSM program, Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN conducts detailed PSM compliance audits every three years.  Each audit incorporates review of process safety information, process hazard analysis, operating procedures, training programs, system mechanical integrity, management of change, pre-start up review procedures, compliance audit procedures, incident investigation procedures, employee participation programs, hot work permit procedures, and contractor safety procedures.

¿ In addition, the local fire department participates in an emergency response drill at the facility on an annual basis.

¿ The USDA maintains a daily presence for moni

toring the Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN facility.

¿ Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN¿s insurance carrier also conducts independent audits on an annual basis.

Five-Year Accident History

Over the last five years, Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN has not experienced a reportable accidental off-site release of anhydrous ammonia from the ammonia refrigeration system.

Emergency Response Program

Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN has documented emergency response procedures in the facility¿s Emergency Response/Action Plan in order to facilitate response efforts in the event of an off-site anhydrous ammonia release.  Included in the Plan are measures to be taken internally by Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN as well as measures to be taken by off-site response agencies.

Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN has trained on-site personnel to respond to accidental ammonia releases.  These personnel are trained according to their duties and functions in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.120, OSHA¿s Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response regulations.  These personnel receive initial training and annual update training thereafter.

To assure that the local governmental response agencies are familiar with Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN¿s emergency response procedures, Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN will provide copies of the Emergency Response/Action Plan and future major revisions for review and approval by the local agencies.  The following local agencies are included for EPRA Plan review and approval:

¿ Newbern Fire Department
¿ Dyersburg Fire Department
¿ Dyer County Emergency Planning Committee

To plan for an ammonia release with off-site consequences, Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN¿s Emergency Response/Action Plan includes procedures and equipment to mitigate the release, procedures to inform local response agencies, transportation maps for response agencies, evacuation route maps, and procedures for public communication.

In the event of an

anhydrous ammonia release with off-site consequences, the general public will be warned using police and fire vehicles equipped with public address systems.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Ammonia refrigeration is a mature industry employing known technology.  Yet, the plant remains abreast of current innovations that improve safety.  To this end, the Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN is an active member of International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration (IIAR) and the Refrigerating Engineers & Technicians Association (RETA).  This involvement enables the facility to learn and implement the most modern safety system improvements as they emerge within the ammonia refrigeration industry.  Computer management systems enhance reliable operation of the RMP covered process. Some of the most recent planned improvements include installation of new equipment and piping relocations to improve both employee safety and the safety of the RMP covered process.

SARA LEE CORPORATION ¿ NEWBERN, TN
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Background Data

In accordance with Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations Chapter 68 (40 CFR 68) promulgated by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN, submits this Risk Management Plan (RMP) for operations at their Newbern, Tennessee facility. The Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN operations include the manufacturing of pork sausage for public consumption packaged under the familiar brand name of Jimmy Dean Sausage.  Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN has been in operation at this facility for over twenty years providing quality meat products and over 800 jobs to the local community.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policy

Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN is committed to protecting the health of its employees, the surrounding community, and the environment; therefore it is Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN¿s policy to maintain compliance with 40 CFR 68 as well as Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) regulations promulgated as Title 29 of the Code of Federal Regulations, Chapter 1910, Section 119 (29 CFR 1910.119), and OSHA¿s Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response regulations (29 CFR 1910.120). 

Stationary Sources and Regulated Substances

Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN is subject to 112® because ammonia, a regulated substance, is present at the facility in amounts greater than 10,000 pounds.  Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN is required to maintain low temperatures in the food processing areas of the plant that are within standards required by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) to ensure quality in the final products.  Sara Lee Corporation ¿ Newbern, TN uses anhydrous ammonia as a refrigerant to maintain the 275,000 ft2 facility within the required range of operating temperatures.  Anhydrous ammonia is an industry-standard refrigerant for meat processing plants.
